oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Heroes; Men; Military uniforms; Medals
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World War, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin York returning from service in France in World War I. He wears his uniform and his overseas cap. His Congressional Medal of Honor and Croix de Guerre are both visible on his chest. He carries his large pack with him over his left shoulder. Text underneath the image describes York's pre-war life and details his exploits in the war.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Central News Services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin York was one of the most decorated American soldiers in World War I. He was awarded a Congressional Medal of Honor and a French Croix de Guerre for taking a German machine gun nest and assisting in the capture of 132 German soldiers.
